thread.title: Snoop Dogg launches online 'marijuana hub' Merry Jane
thread.title_full: Snoop Dogg launches online 'marijuana hub' Merry Jane

title: Snoop Dogg launches online 'marijuana hub' Merry Jane
text:
Tip : Use comma (,) to separate multiple quotes. Learn more... 
Tue, Sep 22, 2015, 10:56 BST - UK Markets close in 5 hrs 34 mins Snoop Dogg launches online 'marijuana hub' Merry Jane By Rebecca Burn-Callander | Telegraph – 4 minutes 40 seconds ago Print 
The rapper announces, 'My name is Snoop Dogg, and I’m a stoner' at a start-ups event in San Francisco 
Snoop Dogg, the US rapper , has built a new online platform for marijuana smokers, to help increase awareness about the drug. 
Speaking at the TechCrunch Disrupt conference in San Francisco on Monday, the self-confessed "stoner" said that Merry Jane , a play on Mary Jane, the slang term for marijuana, would be an information hub for everyone interested in the drug. 
“After watching where the cannabis industry is headed, I wanted to create a platform that will take this movement further by creating a destination where people could find fresh content,” Snoop Dogg said. “Merry Jane is a game-changing platform for pop culture. It’s a new frontier y’all!” 
He said that it would be a lifestyle media site, hosting information about marijuana products and a location-mapping tool to find dispensaries. 
According to the United Nations, 158.8 million people around the world use marijuana—more than 3.8pc of the planet’s population. 
Several states in the US have either decriminalised marijuana or legalised it for medical use . 
The site, which will launch in October, will also produce a video interview series called Deflowered to profile proponents of the weed-smoking scene around the world. 
There will be news on cannabis policy, the business of marijuana and its economic effects, he added. 
“There are so many people in the closet," Snoop Dogg said. "We are giving them an opportunity to come out of the closet and just admit they like to smoke. I’m a smoker, my name is Snoop Dogg, and I’m a stoner.” 
The singer b ehind hits Drop It Like It's Hot and Smoke The Weed has launched the business alongside media entrepreneur Ted Chung. 
Mr Chung said “advertising is definitely part of the plan” and claimed that the demand for Merry Jane was significant, with 420 users signing up to the beta site. 
Merry Jane is supported by the actor Seth Rogen and backed by Snoop Dogg's own venture capital firm Casa Verde Capital. 
This isn't Snoop Dogg's first foray into marijuana-based business . 
Earlier this year, he joined a consortium of investors backing Eaze , a California-based startup that promises to deliver medical marijuana to your doorstep in less than 10 minutes. 
In 2012, the rapper released Rolling Words: A Smokeable Songbook , which was printed entirely on hemp seed paper, with perforations for easy rolling. He has also lent his name to a brand of rolling papers. 
According to CB Insights, the weed industry raised $104m (£67m) in venture capital over in 59 deals during 2014. 
Privateer Holdings, which sells Bob Marley-branded weed, secured a $75m investment from Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund.
